content: YES! There will be a C-CDA Implementation-A-Thon track at the FHIR Connectathon in Atlanta. Save the date: Sep 14, 2019 to Sep 20, 2019 - Atlanta Marriott Marquis, Atlanta GA.

C-CDA IAT 201909 Preparation
C-CDA Creation Workflow

In preparation for the C-CDA IAT 201909 we are collecting information about C-CDA document creation capabilities in EHR systems. If you are the C-CDA IAT representative for an EHR solution, please respond to this survey: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/DPVTJMH

In preparation for the C-CDA IAT 201909 we are collecting information about C-CDA document consumption capabilities in EHR systems. If you are the C-CDA IAT representative for an EHR solution, please respond to this survey: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/Y7V57R9

REMINDER C-CDA IAT Track Preparation Calls will be held on the following Wednesdays at 2:00pm ET

August 7, 14, 21, 28; Sept 4,11
Find the agendas on Confluence: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/IAT/2019.09.14+Atlanta%2C+Georgia+C-CDA+IAT+Preparation

Join the meeting from your computer, tablet or smartphone.
https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/458306629

You can also dial in using your phone.
United States (Toll Free): 1 866 899 4679
- One-touch: tel:+18668994679,,458306629#
United States: +1 (669) 224-3319
- One-touch: tel:+16692243319,,458306629#

Access Code: 458-306-629

The Atlanta FHIR Connectathon Count Down Has Started. THREE WEEKS TO GO!!
It is time to start preparing your samples files.

The Patient Scenario file has been posted. There are Two Required Samples and Two Optional Samples. There are suggestions on what to do if you are new to generating C-CDA files and need tips on how to get started.

GET THE PATIENT SCENARIO FILE HERE--> https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=5996832&preview=/5996832/58658489/C-CDA%20IAT%20Patient%20Story%20v10%2020190819.docx

The Drop Box Folder for the September Connectathon C-CDA IAT Track has been shared to permit viewing of the Resources folder. This link will take you to the viewable top-level folder.
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/uydj64ff4ti0v62/AABtF6AUkWtgdTBLEEN3OsDSa?dl=0

HL7 C-CDA IAT 20190914-15

The Drop Box Folder for the September Connectathon C-CDA IAT Track has been shared to permit viewing of the Resources folder. This link will take you to the viewable top-level folder.
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/uydj64ff4ti0v62/AABtF6AUkWtgdTBLEEN3OsDSa?dl=0

The 00 Resources Folder now has the updated Patient Story we will be using to create the example files.

We were able to parse nearly a dozen of the XML files from the DropBox folder. Very much a work in progress, but looking forward to testing via XML over HTTP and working on CCD on FHIR.

Symptomatic-CCDA-Implementationathon.png

We were able to parse nearly a dozen of the XML files from the DropBox folder. Very much a work in progress, but looking forward to testing via XML over HTTP and working on CCD on FHIR.

Symptomatic-CCDA-Implementationathon.png

Abigail, thanks for your proactive work on this. Can't wait to see your results!

Links for today for C-CDA IAT Survey: (Same as April 7)
Creators: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/DPVTJMH
Consumers: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/Y7V57R9

Dropbox folder for this weekend's IAT - https://www.dropbox.com/sh/1wk6vuynw0ih3rf/AADs_0ansJCDJCzm2gzbqhIFa?dl=0

HL7 C-CDA IAT 20190914-15

Abilgail mentioned some examples of how FHIR is documenting meta-data for source. For those looking for the CDA/C-CDA. I wanted to provide some examples that historically have been through the Examples Task Force Regarding:

Here's an exmple
http://cdasearch.hl7.org/examples/view/General/External%20Document%20Reference
(Search for <externalDocument> and <externalObservation>)
Interesting, thank you. You are pulling out the time range statements and Summary.

Sunday morning's meeting is actually on the Lobby level, so it should be L503 and L504, not M. Again, it's at the end of the hall (which is directly above registration). Keep going, then when you see some stairs... go down; we're on the left.
reminder to update your attendance at the IAT - https://confluence.hl7.org/display/IAT/2019.09.14+Atlanta%2C+Georgia+C-CDA+IAT+Attendee+List

Here is the "infographic" that I showed on Q3 of C-CDA IAT (38 ways the same 3 meds are shown, part of a 2018 publication)
https://github.com/jddamore/ccda-samples/blob/master/z-infographic/medications.jpg
